security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation (SKILL.md) with writing assistance instructions. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or security-sensitive operations exist. All static findings are false positives from markdown documentation being misidentified as code patterns. The skill is a pure prompt-based writing guide with no security risks.

content.user_title: Write Better Content with AI Research Partner
content.value_statement: Writing alone is hard. This skill transforms your writing process by providing a collaborative AI partner that researches topics, adds citations, improves hooks, and gives real-time feedback on each section as you write.
actual_capabilities: Creates collaborative outlines with clear structure and flow
Conducts research and adds credible citations to support claims
Improves article hooks with data-driven, story-based, or question alternatives
Provides section-by-section feedback on clarity, flow, and evidence
Preserves writer's unique voice and style throughout the process
Manages citations in multiple formats (inline, numbered, footnotes)
limitations: Cannot access real-time internet research - uses pre-existing knowledge
Requires user to provide writing samples for voice matching
Feedback quality depends on specificity of user requests
Cannot publish or format content for specific platforms

use_cases.title: Research and write articles faster
use_cases.description: Collaborate with AI to outline, research, and draft blog posts with proper citations and compelling hooks

use_cases.title: Create documentation with sources
use_cases.description: Write technical documentation that includes research, examples, and proper citations for credibility

use_cases.title: Craft engaging newsletter content
use_cases.description: Develop newsletter content with strong openings, clear structure, and audience-specific messaging

prompt_templates.title: Create Article Outline
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new article from scratch
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create an outline for an article about [topic] for [target audience]. The goal is to [educate/persuade/entertain].

prompt_templates.title: Research and Add Citations
prompt_templates.prompt: Research [specific topic] and find credible sources with data to support my argument about [your claim].

prompt_templates.title: Improve Hook
prompt_templates.prompt: Here's my introduction: [paste text]. Help me make the hook more compelling for [target audience].

prompt_templates.title: Section Feedback
prompt_templates.prompt: I just finished writing the '[section name]' section. Please review it for clarity, flow, and evidence quality.

output_examples.input: Help me create an outline about AI's impact on healthcare for medical professionals
output: Creates structured outline with hook about AI diagnosing diseases
Identifies 3 main sections: diagnostics, treatment, ethics
Marks research gaps: latest FDA approvals, adoption statistics
Suggests compelling data points to find
Provides clear flow from problem to solution

output_examples.input: Here's my introduction: Product management is changing because of AI. In this article, I'll discuss some ways AI affects product managers.
output: Suggests data-driven hook: "Last month, I asked AI to analyze 500 customer interviews..."
Offers question-based hook: "What if you could talk to every customer..."
Proposes story hook: "Sarah spent two weeks building the wrong feature..."
Explains why each hook works for different audiences

output_examples.input: I just finished the 'Common Mistakes' section. Thoughts?
output: Identifies strengths: strong examples, clear structure, practical advice
Flags need for data/citations in third mistake
Recommends reordering for better impact progression

best_practices: Work incrementally - get feedback on each section before moving to the next
Save research in a separate file to build your knowledge base
Share examples of your writing style to help AI match your voice
anti_patterns: Don't ask AI to write entire articles without your input - collaborate instead
Avoid generic prompts - provide context about audience and goals
Never use AI research without verifying sources and citations

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude web interface?
faq.answer: Yes, but works best with Claude Code for file management and version control

faq.question: How long should my article be?
faq.answer: Any length works. The skill adapts to blog posts, long-form articles, or short pieces

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my CMS?
faq.answer: Write in markdown files, then copy to your CMS. Works with any platform supporting markdown

faq.question: How does the skill handle my data?
faq.answer: All content stays in your local files. No data is transmitted or stored externally

faq.question: What if I disagree with AI suggestions?
faq.answer: You control all decisions. AI provides options, you choose what to use or ignore

faq.question: How does this compare to other writing tools?
faq.answer: Focuses on collaboration and research rather than just grammar checking or auto-completion
